page.title: 12THE CATHEDRAL CLOSE
page.content: THE CATHEDRAL CLOSE GREW UP ROUND THE CATHEDRAL. THE OLDEST BUILDINGS DATE FROM TUDOR TIMES BUT MOST BUILDINGS WERE RESTORED DURING VICTORIA'S REIGN ALTHOUGH THERE IS A FINE EXAMPLE OF GEORGIAN ARCHITECTURE AT NUMBER 9 THE CLOSE. ALMONERS HOUSE AND THE "POOR WINDOW" WHERE ALMS WERE DISTRIBUTED IS STILL VISIBLE. A WALL DIVIDED THE UPPER 1-4 AND LOWER 6-14 POINTS OF THE CLOSE UNTIL THE 18TH CENTURY. THE UPPER PART WAS A CEMETERY FOR LAY-PEOPLE UNTIL THE 18TH CENTURY, IT IS NOW USED AS A CAR PARK. NUMBER 8 WAS ORIGINALLY THE MONASTIC GUEST HOUSE, THE 15TH CENTURY HALL REMAINS BEHIND THE GEORGIAN FRONTAGE.
